data.why:
I have written a small module that facilitates communcation with a
    Davis Vantage Pro weather station connected via a serial port.
    Developed on Linux, should work on most varieties of unix. I also
    have a daemon written in Perl that uses this module. The daemon
    gathers input from the station, produces comma seperated files
    containing observations for each minute of the day, the daily
    extreme values, and the most current readings available. It also can
    update the Weather Underground at user configurable intervals, and
    will store the daily extremes in a database (mysql by default).
